steps.description: GDB non-insulated → rooftop condensation risk → suggest GDMI
steps.query: I need a GDB 600x600 FZ housing for rooftop installation. Airflow 3000 m³/h.
steps.response_text: for your rooftop installation requiring 3000 m³/h airflow, the gdb filter housing is not suitable for outdoor environments due to its bolted construction, which does not meet leakage and hygiene requirements. outdoor installations also expose the system to condensation risk on non-insulated metal surfaces. to address this, we recommend the gdmi modulfilterskåp, which is specifically designed for outdoor use. to proceed with the gdmi modulfilterskåp configuration, i need two details: what is the minimum expected ambient temperature at the installation site? high humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency. keep relative humidity below 70% for optimal performance.

assertions.name: no_length_question
assertions.expected: 550mm or 750mm|which length for gdb|gdb housing length
assertions.actual: for your rooftop installation requiring 3000 m³/h airflow, the gdb filter housing is not suitable for outdoor environments due to its bolted construction, which does not meet leakage and hygiene requirements. outdoor installations also expose the system to condensation risk on non-insulated metal su

steps.description: GDMI 600x600 AZ capacity 3400 ≥ 3000 → OK, ask length (600 or 850)
steps.query: Switch to GDMI. Use Aluzink (AZ) material instead of FZ.
steps.response_text: for the rooftop project, we're switching to the gdmi housing. unfortunately, fz material is not available for gdmi housings. however, aluzink (az) and zinkmagnesium (zm) are excellent alternatives offering c4 and c5 corrosion resistance, respectively.  to finalize the configuration, i need two details: what is the minimum expected ambient temperature at the installation site? high humidity reduces carbon adsorption efficiency. keep relative humidity below 70% for optimal performance.
